intro: Fuchsia globosa, commonly known as the globular fuchsia, is a species native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Fuchsia globosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
